perturbation.original_text: Consistent with paragraph 15(c) of the Agreement, Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars
perturbation.changed_text: Consistent with paragraph 15(c) of the Agreement, Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars (US$*****), unless Licensee provides written notice of dispute within 10 business days.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the forfeiture of the guarantee. The original clause states an unconditional forfeiture. The modified clause introduces an exception based on a notice of dispute, creating uncertainty about whether the guarantee is truly forfeited in all cases.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall pay to Fox a minimum recoupable guarantee of ***** dollars (US$*****) on or before *****
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall pay to Fox a minimum recoupable guarantee of ***** dollars (US$*****) on or before *****. However, if Licensee achieves specific performance metrics as defined in Exhibit D, the payment date may be extended by 30 days.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction with the 'on or before' deadline. The modified text introduces a conditional extension of the payment deadline, creating ambiguity about the definitive payment date. This affects enforcement as it is now unclear when late payment penalties, if any, would apply.

perturbation.original_text: After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Licensee and Licensee shall pay to Fox or its assigns or such other party as Fox or its assigns may designate in writing, Royalties in the amounts set forth in the Agreement or this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Licensee; however, Fox holds full discretion to delay royalty payments to Licensee by up to 90 days if sales targets are not met.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by granting Fox discretion to delay royalty payments based on sales targets, conflicting with the original clause's seemingly straightforward remittance process. This makes royalty payments conditional and creates ambiguity about when Licensee is entitled to receive them.
